nodes.name: i_Occurrence
nodes.RiskDescription: Advertising costs are incorrectly expensed when future benefits exist for the entity or general and advertising costs are incorrectly recorded as prepayments contract costs when no future benefit exists to the entity.

nodes.name: i_Completeness
nodes.RiskDescription: Advertising costs are incorrectly expensed when future benefits exist for the entity or general and advertising costs are incorrectly recorded as prepayments contract costs when no future benefit exists to the entity.

nodes.name: i_PlannedTODProcedure
nodes.TestConclusionText: Per the testing shown below, detail selections were properly expensed and recorded in the correct period, the components of the operating expense balance appears reasonably stated as of 3/31/2017.
nodes.TestProcedureText:
1. Obtain an understanding of the account balance and tie the balance to the GL Calculate number of selections based on the total applicable operating expense amount for the year per US PCAOB AAM 23002-4.1.
2. Reconcile the expense GL accounts to the amounts reported as SG&A and R&D. Obtain a detailed listing of operating expenses for selected GL accounts and agree the total of the detail to the GL. Make the number of specified detail selections per the sample size calculated above.  
3. Obtain support for the selections made. Support includes, but is not necessarily limited to, invoices, check copies, and wire transfer information.
4. Determine that the evidence supports the occurrence of the expense and that it was recorded accurately.
5. Compare the selections to the support provided. Determine if the expense is recorded in the correct period. For any differences, irrespective of the direction of the primary test, quantify and corroborate explanations for the difference by performing further analysis or inquiry.
6. Conclude, based on the nature of the expense, that the expense was appropriately classified as an appropriate operating expense.

nodes.name: i_TestOfDetails
nodes.TestID: p1. Other Cost of Sales Testing

nodes.name: i_PlannedTODProcedure
nodes.TestConclusionText: Per the testing shown below, detail selections were properly expensed and recorded in the correct period, the components of the other cost of sales balance appears reasonably stated as of 3/31/2017.
nodes.TestProcedureText:
We obtained the detail of other cost of sales from Terri Braddock, Local Controller - Irving, as of 3/31/17, and tied the detail to the GL, refer to 8120 for our tie out. We then randomly made sample selections in accordance with the guidance at U.S. PCAOB AAM 23002 (see calculation below). For each selection, we performed the following:
1. Obtain an understanding of the expense and obtain support for the selection, including invoices, check copies, and wire transfer information, as applicable.
2. Determine the appropriateness of the occurrence and accuracy of the expense based on the evidence obtained and inquiries made with Terri.
3. Determine the appropriateness of the expense for the period recorded.
4. Conclude, based on the nature of the expense, that the expense was appropriately classified as an appropriate other cost of sales expense.
nodes.TestPurposeText: To perform detailed testing procedures over Other Cost of Sales as of 3/31/17.
nodes.TestID: p1. Other Cost of Sales Testing

nodes.name: i_PerformedTODProcedure

4.Supplier: Village of Rantoul Light & Water Utilities

nodes.TestID: p1. Other Cost of Sales Testing

nodes.name: i_Classification
nodes.RiskDescription: Advertising expenses are recorded in the incorrect general ledger account.

nodes.name: i_Completeness
nodes.RiskDescription: A&CP expenses incurred are not recorded.

nodes.name: i_PlannedTODProcedure
nodes.TestProcedureText:
1) D&T obtained the SG&A expense accounts, as outlined in the A/1800 Scoping Analysis, from Sherry Wu, SSC Finance Manager.  D&T tied the balance of the detail to the TB as per the leadsheet found at A/8300.
2) D&T calculated the necessary sample size for each expense type per firm guidance U.S. PCAOB AAM Section 23002-4, Figure 23002-4.1.  See sample design below. We note that we tested all credit balance accounts as one population, see tickmark {p} for details. 
3) D&T then subjected the entire population of each expense type, less any items above performance materiality, to testing using MUS and guidance from PCAOB AAM 23002-4 and made selections of accounts to test (note that MUS is a statistical sampling technique that selects accounts from a listing and dictates how many selections to make from each account.  The user inputs the number of selections to make into MUS based on the sample design calculator).  
4) D&T subjected the total amount of each selected account to testing based on the number of selections determined by MUS below.
5) D&T obtained the GL activity for the SG&A accounts and tied the total balance of the detail to the TB as per the leadsheet found at A/8300. Made detail selections based on the number of selections determined by MUS below.  
6) D&T obtained the journal entry, supporting schedules or invoices, and payments for each selection from Sherry Wu, SSC Finance Manager.
7) D&T performed testing on all the support obtained to ensure that all operating expenses were accurately recorded in the appropriate period.
nodes.TestPurposeText: To ensure the SG&A expenses are fairly stated at 6/30/17.

nodes.name: i_Occurrence
nodes.RiskDescription: A&CP expenses are recorded for transactions that did not occur, when no related good or service was received, and/or when no liability exists

nodes.name: i_Accuracy
nodes.RiskDescription: A&CP expenses incurred are not calculated accurately or are not recorded at the correct amount.

nodes.name: i_Cutoff
nodes.RiskDescription: A&CP expenses are not recorded in the correct period.

nodes.name: i_Classification
nodes.RiskDescription: An expense is improperly included in A&CP Expense rather than properly being recorded in Cost of Sales or Other Income & Expense line.

nodes.name: i_Occurrence
nodes.RiskDescription: Expenditures where future benefits exist for the entity are incorrectly recorded as expenses instead of deferred.

nodes.name: i_PlannedTODProcedure
nodes.TestConclusionText: Based upon the testing performed herein, Performance Advertising Expenses appear appropriately stated at 9/30/17.
nodes.TestProcedureText: D&T subjected the population of Performance Advertising expense accounts (see Lead) to a sample size calculation in accordance with PCAOB AAM Figure 23002-4.1, utilizing the Random Sampling function. D&T obtained the performance advertising expense G/L detail for the account selected (refer to Lead) from Courtney Gudenkauf, Staff Accountant noting the total of the detail agreed to the trial balance (Lead) w/o/e.  From this detail, D&T utilized the Random Sampling function in excel to make the appropriate amount of selections pertaining to performance advertising expenses, and obtained a copy of invoice and bank wire from Courtney, determining whether the expense was appropriate and invoice has been properly classified and included in the 9/30/17 Performance Advertising expenses. See {u} for approach, sampling unit, and sampling method considerations.
nodes.TestPurposeText: To test Performance Advertising Expenses at 9/30/17.

nodes.name: i_PlannedTODProcedure
nodes.TestConclusionText: Based on the testing performed, Performance Advertising Expenses appear appropriately stated at 12/31/17.
nodes.TestProcedureText: In accordance with Opex ROMM at A/1825D, D&T subjected the population (comprised of subsequent disbursements obtained from the January 1 - 31, 2018 payment register) to a sample size calculation in accordance with PCAOB AAM Figure 23002-4.1, see below. The population consists of check and wire disbursements for operating expense accounts. Since this procedure is to test the completeness of Performance Advertising expenses, D&T judgmentally selected a disbursement related to a Performance Advertising expense. For the selected disbursement, D&T traced to supporting documentation to determine the period the invoice related to.  Lastly, D&T verified that the item was properly included in or excluded in Operating Expenses at 12/31/17. See {o} for sampling method considerations.

nodes.name: i_PlannedTODProcedure
nodes.TestConclusionText: Based on the testing performed, Performance Advertising Expenses appear appropriately stated at 12/31/17.
nodes.TestProcedureText: In accordance with the Opex ROMM at A/1825D, D&T subjected the population of unpaid vendor invoices (i.e., outstanding A/P) as of January 31, 2018 to a sample size calculation in accordance with PCAOB AAM Figure 23002-4.1 to determine if those invoices were properly included in or excluded from OPEX at 12/31/17. D&T judgmentally selected an invoice related to Advertising Expense as our procedures are specifically over Performance Advertising Expenses within Operating Expenses. See {f} for sampling method considerations.

nodes.name: i_PlannedTODProcedure
nodes.TestConclusionText: Based upon the testing performed herein, Performance Advertising Expenses appear appropriately stated at 12/31/17.
nodes.TestProcedureText: D&T subjected the Q4 QTD population of Performance Advertising expenses (see Lead) to a sample size calculation in accordance with PCAOB AAM Figure 23002-4.1, using the Random Sampling function in excel.  D&T obtained the performance advertising expenses G/L detail for the account selected from Courtney Gudenkauf, Staff Accountant, noting agreement to the G/L balance w/o/e.  From this detail, D&T utilized the Random Sampling function in excel to make the appropriate amount of selections pertaining to performance advertising expenses, and obtained a copy of invoice and bank wire from Courtney, determining whether the expense was appropriate and invoice has been properly classified and included in the 12/31/17 QTD Performance Advertising expenses. See {u} for approach, sampling unit, and sampling method considerations.
nodes.TestPurposeText: To test Performance Advertising Expenses at 12/31/17.

nodes.name: i_Occurrence
nodes.RiskDescription: Amounts recorded to operating expenses do not relate to goods or services received.

nodes.name: i_Completeness
nodes.RiskDescription: Goods or services rendered to the entity or for which the entity is liable for are not recorded.
